title: 103_hr82
content: Restoration of deduction for interest on educational loans. The amendment defines personal interest to include interest on qualified educational loans provided by certain programs or organizations. The amendment allows for the deduction of interest on qualified educational loans from specific programs or organizations, including federal, state, or state-based guarantee programs, 501(c)(3) organizations, and financial institutions under supplemental education programs. The interest must be incurred to pay for qualified educational expenses within a reasonable timeframe. The deduction of interest on qualified educational loans is allowed for specific programs or organizations, including federal, state, or state-based guarantee programs, 501(c)(3) organizations, and financial institutions under supplemental education programs. The interest must be used to pay for qualified educational expenses within a reasonable timeframe. The amount of interest deductible is subject to a phaseout based on the taxpayer's adjusted gross income. The deduction for interest on qualified educational loans is subject to a phaseout based on the taxpayer's adjusted gross income. The applicable dollar amount and phaseout range vary depending on the filing status. The deduction is only allowable for the first 48 months of the loan repayment period. The deduction for interest on qualified educational loans is only allowable for the first 48 months of the loan repayment period. Qualified educational expenses include tuition and related expenses for the taxpayer, spouse, or dependent attending an eligible educational institution. The tax code allows for a deduction of interest on qualified educational loans for the first 48 months of repayment. Qualified educational expenses cover tuition and related costs for individuals attending an eligible institution. The deduction amount is adjusted annually for inflation. The tax code allows for a deduction of interest on qualified educational loans for the first 48 months of repayment, adjusted annually for inflation. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1993, with respect to loans with the first required payment after that date.
